intro: Cleisostoma taiwanianum, commonly known as the Taiwan cleisostoma, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are usually broad and革质 (leathery), and it produces showy, colorful blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
